meanings.definition: To cut food into thin strips.
meanings.sent1: She carefully julienne the carrots for the salad.
meanings.sent2: I always julienne the bell peppers for stir-fry dishes.
meanings.sent3: The chef attempted to julienne the cheese, but it turned out more like cubes.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in julienning the cucumbers was like watching an artist at work.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the knife julienning the onions filled the kitchen with a rhythmic melody.

meanings.definition: A method of cutting vegetables into matchstick-sized pieces.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for a cup of vegetable julienne.
meanings.sent2: The julienne of carrots added a nice crunch to the dish.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his attempt at julienne resembled tiny toothpicks.
meanings.sent4: The colorful julienne of vegetables on the plate looked like a vibrant mosaic.
meanings.sent5: The chef's skillful julienne transformed the ordinary salad into a work of art.
